page.title: 01UPPER HALE
page.content: HALE,that is Upper and Lower Hale, is supposed to be the largest village in England. The old village surrounds the {Green.}At the crossroads above the Green stands {St Marks Church},100 years old in 1983, and {the Middle {School,}which is a listed building carefullyrefurbished. nearby is the modern{First School}. Further North there is a council estate built on some Army land, the rest of which is used for exercises. Across the main road to Odiham is the {Folly Hill {private housing}estate, mainly of detached houses. There is also a modern First School on the Estate. There are many shops including two bakers, a butcher, two newsagents,two hairdressers and three general stores.There are other shops nearb y.The Post Office has closed.There is a bus hourly to Aldershot & Farnham.
